name: Mark's English Sausage Rolls
author: POSHIE25
summary: I had never heard of these until I met my husband, Mark, who is English. They are simple and delicious! They freeze really well too.
ingredients: 1 (17.25 ounce) package frozen puff pastry sheets, thawed
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Unfold the puff pastry sheets, and cut along the fold lines of each sheet to form 6 equal squares for a total of 12 squares
Divide sausage into 12 pieces, and roll into small logs
Place one log on each square
Roll dough around the sausage, and seal with a bit of beaten egg
Place rolls onto an ungreased baking sheet, and brush the tops with the rest of the egg
Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the rolls are puffed and golden
I usually watch after 10 minutes or so to make sure they don't burn
